evidence_span: The pressure tubes in Units 3 and 4 of the Pickering Nuclear Generating Station were made from 901

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_021_chunk1
evidence_span: Cracking only occurred when the pressure tubes were cold (i.e., less than about 410 K)

evidence_span: The pressure tubes in this reactor are fabricated from cold-worked 802

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_021_chunk1
evidence_span: Failure was in the form of an approximately $2 \textrm { \textmu m }$ long axial crack

evidence_span: pressure tubes made from 901 are inspected at several stages of their fabrication by ultrasonic and eddy current techniques to ensure that there is a 95% probability that there are no defects present > 0.076 mm deep

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_021_chunk4
evidence_span: cracking in welds in fuel elements made from 901 was prevented by redesigning the end cap to eliminate the notch and heat treating at 825 K for 5 h to lower the residual stresses

source_id: STP939-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_7th Volume_021_chunk4
evidence_span: The residual stresses in the overextended rolled joints in the pressure tubes made from 901 were lowered by either a heat treatment of 825 K for 15 min, which lowered the stresses from 600 MPa to less than 100 MPa
